session_metadata.student_archetype: Cookie-Cutter Bay Area CS-Debater with Zero Authentic Passion
session_metadata.sub_archetype: High-Achieving Autopilot Student Needing Prescriptive Direction

academic_standing.ap_scores: 5 on AP CSA, 5 on AP World History

key_challenges.challenge: Cookie-cutter profile in most saturated demographic
key_challenges.quote: Your profile seems very cookie cutter
key_challenges.context: Bay Area, Asian male, CS interest, debate = thousands with same profile

key_challenges.description: 15+ minutes of discovery questions yielded 'not really' to everything
key_challenges.quote_pattern: Not really... nothing really... just because...

key_challenges.quote: I don't have any extremely positive relationships with teachers... I don't really participate much in class

key_challenges.challenge: Scattered activities with no narrative thread
key_challenges.description: Debate, CS club, SteelCityCodes teaching, USACO - all disconnected

key_challenges.challenge: Parent expectations too high for realistic time allocation
key_challenges.quote: You have to make some hard choices
key_challenges.context: Father wants ToC + USACO Gold + AIME + research + service simultaneously

breakthrough_moments.language: Your profile seems very cookie cutter
breakthrough_moments.significance: Created urgency and clarity for rest of session
breakthrough_moments.student_confirmation: The biggest thing I took away from this is like the whole cookie cutter thing (1:09:44)

breakthrough_moments.trigger: Mode switch from discovery to prescriptive
breakthrough_moments.language: One thing that I'm thinking about... taking the idea of predictive policing and extrapolating to algorithms that make decisions in social contexts
breakthrough_moments.coach_action: Jenny explicitly proposed direction after discovery failed
breakthrough_moments.significance: Recognized pattern: Student has no organic passion, needs guidance not just discovery

breakthrough_moments.question: You mentioned you like planes - what's your favorite?
breakthrough_moments.significance: Potential quirky differentiator identified but not developed in GamePlan

critical_interventions.language: I'm not saying this in a bad way, I'm saying this to point it out early... You're young, you have time to change that
critical_interventions.rationale: Student can't fix what they don't see - must name problem explicitly

critical_interventions.proposal: Algorithmic justice (CS + debate + social impact) OR Climate tech
critical_interventions.rationale: Student needs direction proposed, then 3-6 month exploration to develop authentic connection
critical_interventions.monitoring_plan: Weekly check-ins to assess if genuine interest developing vs. going through motions

critical_interventions.language: You have to make some hard choices... can't do debate camp + USACO Silver + service project + research in one summer
critical_interventions.rationale: Scarcity creates strategy - force prioritization through reality check

narrative_framework_proposed.cause: Algorithmic Justice OR Climate Change (social impact)
narrative_framework_proposed.formula: CS as tool + Debate as voice + [Cause] as reason

option_1.name: Algorithmic Justice
option_1.description: Algorithms in social context - predictive policing, housing allocation, resource distribution

option_2.name: Climate Change Technology
option_2.description: CS applications to climate - modeling, optimization, renewable energy
option_2.strategic_advantage: Sustainability = institutional priority = lower admissions standards

unexplored_option.name: Aviation Technology
unexplored_option.student_signal: I like planes, A380 is my favorite, play aviation video games
unexplored_option.potential: Quirky differentiator - aviation safety algorithms, air traffic control optimization

narrative_development.authenticity_concern: Student showed NO genuine excitement for any option - all responses were 'sounds interesting' (polite but not passionate)
narrative_development.development_plan_needed: 90-day structured exploration with weekly authenticity checkpoints, willingness to pivot if forced

frameworks_introduced.introduction_language: Your profile seems very cookie cutter... I'm not saying this in a bad way, I'm saying this to point it out early
frameworks_introduced.sandwich_technique: Praise (charismatic, impressive record) → Hard truth (cookie cutter) → Softening (not bad way) → Hope (you're young, can change)
frameworks_introduced.student_response: Implicit acceptance, confirmed as key takeaway at end
frameworks_introduced.demographic_specificity: Bay Area, Asian male, CS interest = most saturated demo

frameworks_introduced.pattern_recognition: 5+ discovery questions yielding nothing → Switch modes
frameworks_introduced.prescriptive_approach: Coach proposes direction based on weak signals (predictive policing case mentioned)
frameworks_introduced.monitoring_plan: 3-6 month exploration period with weekly check-ins to assess authenticity development
frameworks_introduced.pivot_criteria: If after 90 days no genuine engagement, try different direction

frameworks_introduced.framework_name: CS as Tool + Debate as Voice + [Cause] as Reason
frameworks_introduced.purpose: Simple, memorable framework student can internalize
frameworks_introduced.application: CS (skill) + Debate (communication) + Algorithmic Justice (why it matters)

frameworks_introduced.introduced_when: When discussing climate vs. algorithmic justice options
frameworks_introduced.insider_knowledge: Sustainability majors = institutional priority = schools want more students = lower admissions standards
frameworks_introduced.quote_from_gameplan: Enrolling sustainability-related majors is what admissions officers term an institutional priority. This means the school wants a greater percentage of students who are interested in sustainability and as a result will have lower standards for these students.
frameworks_introduced.strategic_calculation: CS alone = ultra-competitive. CS + Climate/Sustainability = less competitive
frameworks_introduced.ethical_balance: Still must develop authentic interest, but strategic positioning matters

frameworks_introduced.framework_name: Working Backwards from Outcome (Not Forward from Interests)
frameworks_introduced.founder_quote: Working backwards is our kind of mantra... At the end of the day, the outcome you want is... top school and top programs... We have to start there.
frameworks_introduced.application: Define target (Stanford/MIT) → Reverse-engineer what's needed → Execute tactics
frameworks_introduced.example: Debate camp vs. service project? Which moves toward differentiated profile needed for Stanford? Answer: Service (fills gap) > Debate (reinforces existing)

frameworks_introduced.founder_quote: The narrative is very important... if it doesn't fit into that narrative, you are deprioritizing it.
frameworks_introduced.permission_to_say_no: Turn down prestigious opportunities that don't fit narrative
frameworks_introduced.example: Could win debate camp scholarship (prestigious!) BUT if narrative is 'CS + Climate,' debate doesn't reinforce → BETTER to do climate research
frameworks_introduced.counterintuitive: Reject good opportunities that don't fit strategic narrative

frameworks_introduced.jenny_quote: Don't be afraid to like go out of the mold, even if it's not something that your friends are doing... even if it's something different, like juggling, or I don't know horseback riding, or like competitive cup stacking
frameworks_introduced.strategic_rationale: Memorability matters more than impressiveness - AOs remember 'the aviation kid' not 'another CS student #4,739'
frameworks_introduced.aarnav_application: Aviation interest (A380 favorite) could be developed but wasn't prioritized

frameworks_introduced.introduced_when: Father asked about debate camp vs. USACO vs. service
frameworks_introduced.language: You can't do debate camp + USACO Silver prep + service project + research in one summer... You have to make some hard choices
frameworks_introduced.strategic_purpose: Scarcity creates strategy - forces prioritization based on ROI
frameworks_introduced.application: Force choice between multiple good options → Depth in areas that matter > Breadth across everything

frameworks_introduced.introduced_when: Throughout session and in founder's closing
frameworks_introduced.recognition: Passion can be DEVELOPED, not just discovered - some students on autopilot need guidance
frameworks_introduced.process: Coach proposes → Student explores 3-6 months → Monitor authenticity → Pivot if forced
frameworks_introduced.founder_quote: It's not about enforcing a narrative, because the authenticity comes out. You can smell it, you can sense it, and I'm sure that AOs can actually easily sense it.
frameworks_introduced.middle_ground: Between 'follow your passion' (assumes exists) and 'fake it' (inauthentic) → Structured authentic exploration

continue: Debate (maintain current level, aim for regional/national recognition)
CS Club leadership (but connect to narrative)
USACO participation (Silver → Gold path, but don't sacrifice narrative development)
add_priority_1_critical: Service project in algorithmic justice OR climate (choose ONE within 30 days)
Encode Justice Youth Advisory Board (if algorithmic justice path)
Climate-focused CS research with professor (if climate path)
Specific impactful project with measurable outcomes
add_priority_2_important: Research mentorship (Stanford/Berkeley professor in chosen area)
Summer program aligned with narrative (not generic CS camp)
Competition entries in chosen focus area
deprioritize: Generic CS activities that don't connect to social impact
Debate camp IF conflicts with narrative development (controversial but strategic)
unexplored: Aviation interest development (flight lessons, connect to CS - aviation safety algorithms, air traffic control optimization)

tier_3_time_permitting: Climate-related competitions if that path chosen
awards.target: Win at least 2-3 national/international awards by senior year

sophomore_summer_2024: Research with Stanford/Berkeley professor (algorithmic ethics OR climate tech)
Selective summer program (RSI, TASP-level OR field-specific)
junior_summer_2025: Internship in chosen field (Recidiviz if algorithmic justice)
programs_listed: Field-specific programs aligned with chosen narrative

course_rigor.senior_year_strategy: Load up on APs but don't necessarily take all exams (after admissions decisions)
course_rigor.concern: 7 APs junior year + debate + USACO + service = time management critical
course_rigor.recommendation: May need to reduce one commitment if struggling

testing.sat_act_plan: Take first attempt April/May 2024 OR August 2024
testing.gap_identified: NO specific prep plan detailed in session or GamePlan

teacher_relationships.current_state: Admits no strong relationships, doesn't participate in class
teacher_relationships.critical_problem: Needs 2-3 strong teacher recommendations for top schools
teacher_relationships.action_plan_missing: No specific strategy provided despite identifying gap
teacher_relationships.recommendation: Target 2-3 specific teachers, increase participation, attend office hours weekly, share projects beyond classwork
teacher_relationships.timeline: Start NOW (spring sophomore), build over 18 months

differentiation.primary_strategy: Narrative synthesis - CS + Debate + [Social Impact Cause]
differentiation.demographic_challenge: Bay Area Asian male CS-debater = most saturated
differentiation.solution: Add unique third dimension (algorithmic justice OR climate OR aviation)
differentiation.memorability_goal: Be remembered as 'the algorithmic justice kid' or 'the climate tech advocate' not 'another CS debater'
differentiation.authenticity_monitoring: Weekly check-ins for 90 days to ensure genuine engagement developing

rapport_building: Multi-coach team approach (3 Stanford students + founder = credibility)
Validation of strengths first ('impressive record, charismatic, kind')
Andrew's relatability ('I quit Lincoln Douglas for same reason')
Founder's Google background connecting with father's tech experience
probing_techniques: 15+ minutes of discovery questions before mode-switching
Repeated 'tell me more' attempts even when getting 'not really' responses
Aviation interest probe ('what's your favorite plane?')
Testing for authentic excitement vs. polite interest
confrontation_tactics: EARLY direct confrontation (minute 19, not end of session)
Sandwich technique: Praise → Hard truth → Softening → Hope
Specific demographic framing ('Bay Area, Asian male, CS = saturated')
Creating urgency without hopelessness ('you're young, time to change')
mode_switching: Recognition when discovery failing (5+ 'not really' responses)
Proposing direction based on weak signals (predictive policing case)
Setting up 90-day exploration with authenticity monitoring
resource_bombardment: Specific URLs shared in Zoom chat during session
Then narrowing: 'We'll hone in on highest ROI'
parent_management: Using parent's language (Google terminology, ROI, working backwards)
Founder's direct engagement with parent concerns
Validating high expectations while managing reality (time constraints)
Providing frameworks for decisions, not just opinions
team_validation: Andrew reinforcing from CS + debate background
Summer reinforcing from CS + bio perspective
Multiple experts agreeing = not just one opinion

tier_1_critical: CHOOSE ONE: Algorithmic justice OR Climate path (decision deadline)
Join Encode Justice OR climate org (if chosen)
Target 2 specific teachers for relationship building
Schedule SAT/ACT for April or May
tier_2_important: PSAT prep begins for junior year National Merit

tier_1_critical: Complete first service project milestone (if started)
Attend 3+ meetings of chosen org, assess authentic interest
Strong teacher relationship with at least 1 teacher
tier_2_important: Reach out to professors for summer research (if targeting)
next_90_days_spring_2024.authenticity_checkpoint: After 90 days, assess: Is genuine interest developing in chosen path? Or still going through motions? If latter, PIVOT.

tier_1_critical: Research with professor OR intensive service project (100+ hours)
USACO Silver → Gold attempt (if time permits)
summer_2024_sophomore.hard_choice: If conflict: Debate camp OR service/research? Choose service/research (fills gap in profile)

tier_1_critical: Strong relationships with 2-3 teachers for recommendations
junior_year_2024_2025.time_management_critical: 7 APs + debate + service + research = must make trade-offs if struggling

meta_coaching_moments.explaining_team_approach: Founder: 'I wanted to show your dad... this is where the magic happens... We bring that level of talent and caliber'
meta_coaching_moments.working_backwards_philosophy: Founder: 'Working backwards is our kind of mantra... At the end of the day, the outcome you want is top school... We have to start there'
meta_coaching_moments.authenticity_emphasis: Founder: 'It's not about enforcing a narrative, because the authenticity comes out. You can smell it... AOs can sense it'
meta_coaching_moments.selective_client_base: Founder: 'I don't give this option to many parents... I'll be very honest, we see so many students'
meta_coaching_moments.pattern_recognition: Founder: 'This is fundamentally the problem... cookie cutter... We see it across many students'
meta_coaching_moments.time_investment_disclosure: Founder: 'It takes time. So that's why I'm not scaling for the entire world... Jenny's been with me 2 years'

proprietary_frameworks: Discovery → Prescriptive mode-switching (pattern recognition: 5+ 'not really' → switch)
CS as Tool + Debate as Voice + [Cause] as Reason (3-part narrative formula)
Institutional Priority Strategic Advantage (sustainability = lower standards)
Working Backwards from Outcome (define target → reverse-engineer)
Narrative-First Activity Selection (permission to reject prestigious if doesn't fit)
Time Allocation Forcing Function (scarcity creates strategy)
Cookie-Cutter Direct Confrontation with Sandwich Technique
insider_knowledge_examples: Sustainability majors = institutional priority = easier admission path
Encode Justice Youth Advisory Board (specific org most coaches don't know)
Free programs often more prestigious (merit-based) than paid
competitive_moats: Multi-coach Stanford student team with diverse specializations
500+ student interviews → pattern recognition (what works for Stanford/MIT admits)
Comprehensive program/award database with strategic intelligence
Real-time adaptive coaching with mode-switching capability

in_session: No standardized testing strategy detailed (SAT/ACT prep plan missing)
No teacher relationship action plan despite identifying gap
No specific time allocation breakdown (hours per week per activity)
Aviation interest mentioned but not developed
No backup narrative options if primary doesn't resonate
in_gameplan: No 90-day exploration plan with weekly milestones for passion development
No authenticity checkpoint criteria (how to know if pivoting needed?)
No specific award application timeline with deadlines
No professor outreach plan (which professors? how to approach? when?)
No essay strategy (what to write about given narrative?)
No parent expectation alignment document (priority ranking agreed?)
No backup narrative if algorithmic justice AND climate both fail to resonate
follow_up_needed: Weekly check-ins (not biweekly) for first 90 days to monitor authenticity
Explicit decision on aviation interest: pursue or ignore?
168-hour weekly time breakdown to force realistic prioritization
SAT/ACT diagnostic test → prep plan → target score
Parent session to align on priority order when conflicts arise

immediate_30_days.decision: Choose algorithmic justice OR climate path
immediate_30_days.relationships: Increase participation in at least 1 class

90_day_authenticity_checkpoint.metric: Student talks about cause with genuine enthusiasm (not just 'sounds interesting')
90_day_authenticity_checkpoint.pivot_criteria: If still going through motions after 90 days, try different direction

end_sophomore_year.testing: SAT 1500+ (first attempt) or clear path to 1550+
end_sophomore_year.narrative: Authentic connection developing in chosen field (observable enthusiasm)

end_junior_year.extracurricular: Leadership in chosen org + measurable impact project
end_junior_year.recommendations: 2-3 teachers who would write 'exceptional student' letters

college_applications.differentiation: Remembered as 'the [specific cause] kid' not 'another CS debater'
college_applications.narrative_coherence: All activities reinforce CS + Debate + [Cause] framework
college_applications.authenticity: Essay shows genuine passion (from 18-month development process)

for_cookie_cutter_bay_area_cs_debaters.emphasize: Narrative differentiation through third dimension (social impact cause)
for_cookie_cutter_bay_area_cs_debaters.avoid: Generic CS activities, more of what everyone else has
key_deliverables: Extensive resource lists (15 awards, 10 orgs, 6 programs)
unique_challenges: Zero authentic passion despite high achievement
Parent pressure to excel in ALL areas simultaneously
Need to DEVELOP passion, not just discover it
Extremely saturated demographic requires unique positioning

effectiveness_indicators.student_engagement: moderate (polite interest but no genuine excitement)
effectiveness_indicators.parent_satisfaction: very_high (father stayed engaged, asked detailed questions)
effectiveness_indicators.authenticity_concern: high (student showed no genuine passion for any proposed direction - requires monitoring)
